content.description:
Start standing at the centre of the boulder with a right hang pinch/crimp at about 1.5m and a left hand crimpy sidepull slightly lower than that and way out to the left.

10 min uphill hike running mostly parallel to the trajectory of the fsr from the desperado boulder. McNair Boulder Guide 1st edition by Eric Jamieson is a good reference document

"The Danger Zone is a bit more difficult to access than the pervious two zones. The hike up from the Desperado Boulder is about 15 minutes and fairly steep. There is also no clear trail (currently) from the Desperado Boulder to the Danger Zone. As long as you do not wander off too much to the left or right while hiking upwards towards the Danger Zone you should be able to spot the boulder. Be cautious of the HUGE death block waiting to fall off of the left hand side of this boulder. This boulder appears to be fairly chossy and Mike, Dylan, and I have pulled and pried off a fair amount of rock from this boulder already, including some large pieces that could have resulted in serious injury if they had fallen on any of us. Be careful, but donâ€™t be deterred!" - from the McNair Creek Bouldering Guidebook 1st Edition
